result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on June 15, 2022 at 09:30 am.

3:01 PM Prosecuting attorney Angela M Wilson appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Brian Scott Midbon in court. Defendant does not qualify with the county attorney  or public defender. He does not have an attorney. Indicates that he will pull together money and needs time to retain counsel. State does not object to resetting the hearing as the defendant has been in compliance with bond conditions. Court indicates that this will be the last reset given the amount of time that has passed since the incident. Defendant indicates that it will take 2 to 3 weeks to secure find before he can hire counsel.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Order denying Court appointed attorney
